column4: Anyone know how much authority this page has? https://help.ubuntu.com/8.04/installation-guide/hppa/mail-setup.html
what do you mean "authority"? that describes the default mail server... you are free to pick and choose whatever you want, it's your machine
It says mutt and exim will be installed by default, which they're not on my system
They should be... certainly exim4
I'm wondering if it's community contributed documentation, wiki style, so it might be completely wrong, or if I should tell someone that it's not necessarily correct
Hmm, exim4 definitely wasn't and isn't installed, but I'm not sure why
My /etc/aliases file was setup correctly though
It is wiki docs... but you can change it if it's completely wrong... I'm positive it's not though...
On my clean install, no mutt and no exim, actually, no working email at all
Note though that it describes the server distro... not the desktop system...
Aha, ok, in which case it's probably correct
I think this is the correct link for my i386 system https://help.ubuntu.com/8.04/installation-guide/i386/mail-setup.html
It has the same info though, saying mutt / exim4 will be installed
Yup... you're right neither are on a desktop system... but on a server, yes
I'd have thought at least exim would make sense on a desktop system, without it I wasn't getting any mails from cron, etc
Any idea how I'd go about notifying someone to update it, or can I edit it directly somewhere?
log in and hit "edit" at the top
I don't see any login / edit / etc options on that page
Looking at the homepage, it looks like that page is aimed at the "alternate" i386 install
You have to log in to the wiki
I can't find that documentation page on the wiki anywhere...
